Special list type which changes are fully synchronizable over network. Use in game object states.
Please note that there are a few useful events available (only for Client-side).

member.name: F:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.State.DeliveryMode.ReliableSequenced
member.summary: Reliable delivery, late messages are dropped (unique channel).

member.name: F:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.State.DeliveryMode.ReliableOrdered

member.summary: Attribute for configuring remote call parameters such as channel and max call rate.

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.State.RemoteCallSettingsAttribute.#ctor(AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.State.DeliveryMode,System.Byte,System.Int16,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remote call settings.
member.param: Max update rate (useful to limit network utilization).
Remote call method argument at this index will be used as a key. Use it if you need to separate remote calls on two independent sequence channels based by what the object is argument.

Group name (for current ProtoEntity) - use it to group sequences/channel for various methods in one class. For example, you can have a shared channel for weapon fire start/stop methods, this way you will always have the valid state (firing/non-firing).

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Scripting.Network.ProtoEntityRemoteExtensions.CallClient``1(``0,AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Characters.ICharacter,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Action{``0}})
member.summary: Calls remote Client method. Use only on the Server-side.
member.param: Player character who will receive this remote call.

Lambda expression of call (see example).
Please note that the server method must have name starting with "ServerRemote_".
Please note that only these argument types are supported:
1. Primitive types such as int, float, string, etc.
2. Proto entities (such as instance of IProtoItem or IProtoCharacter). Use to acquire instance of proto entity.
3. Instances of IGameObject (dynamic/static world objects, characters, projectiles, etc).
4. Instances of objects which classes are implements IRemoteCallParameter.
5. Arrays or lists of 1/2/3 cases.

member.name: P:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesClient.Components.IComponentSpriteRenderer.SpritePivotPoint
member.summary:
Gets or sets the draw origin, normalized.
This is used to specify relative point from which the texture will be drawn.
For X: 0==left, 0.5==center, 1==right
For Y: 0==bottom, 0.5==center, 1==top.
Please note: default draw origin is at bottom-left (X=0, Y=0).
Please note: if you want to draw from center use (X=0.5, Y=0.5).

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesClient.IItemsClientService.MoveOrSwapItem(AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItemsContainer,System.Nullable{System.Byte},System.Nullable{System.UInt16},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the item into the container.
Please note: you can specify a specific slot. If the item is available at this slotId, it will be swapped with the specified item.
member.param: (optional) Slot id into which the item should be placed. Can be null.
(optional) (only for stackable items) Count to move from item. Should be greater than 0 and lower than "item.Count".
(optional) Determines if the game should write an error to the log when the item cannot be moved or swapped.

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesClient.IItemsClientService.SetCount(AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets item count. The count must not exceed MaxItemsPerStack of its item type.
Please note: if count is zero, the item will be destroyed. You cannot change countToDestroy of the item after that.
Please note: this is special Client-side method. It overrides item count (but server may send proper count if something incorrect happens). Use it only when you need to change instant count on the Client-side and will do the same operation on the Server-side also (like reloading weapon).
member.param: New count for item. It must not exceed MaxItemsPerStack of its item type (an exception will be thrown).

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesClient.IItemsClientService.StackItems(AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Removes count from the first item and adds it to the second item.
Applicable only for stackable items of the same type.
Please note that if you specify "count==itemFrom.Count" it will destroy "itemFrom" completely!
Please note if you don't specify count (or specify 0), this method will move as much as possible.
member.param: Count to move (if 0 - move as much as possible).

Creates skeleton animation renderer for world object.
member.param: World object to attach to this renderer.
Default skeleton animation resource. Please note that must contain it.
Default animation name. Please note that this animation should be looped (like regular idle animation).
(optional) Draw offset in world units (if you want to render this skeleton offsetted on +1 on axis X, -1 on axis Y, use "(1,-1)").
(optional) Draw order. Use it if you need to render this skeleton over other objects.
(optional) Time scale - allows slowing down/speeding up animation. For example, "0.5" will slow down twice, "2" will speed up twice.
member.returns: Instance of skeleton animations manager (component attached to the scene object which is attached to the world object).

member.summary: Creates skeleton animation renderer for world object.
member.param: Scene object to attach this render.
Default skeleton animation resource. Please note that must contain it.
Default animation name. Please note that this animation should be looped (like regular idle animation).
(optional) Draw offset in world units (if you want to render this skeleton offsetted on +1 on axis X, -1 on axis Y, use "(1,-1)").
(optional) Draw order. Use it if you need to render this skeleton over other objects.
(optional) Time scale - allows slowing down/speeding up animation. For example, "0.5" will slow down twice, "2" will speed up twice.
member.returns: Instance of skeleton animations manager (component attached to the scene object which is attached to the world object).

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesServer.IDatabaseService.Set``1(System.String,System.String,``0)
member.summary: Stores/associated the value in the server database dictionary with the provided key. If you're storing an non-immutable object (such as list of something), you can do this only once. Please note that this action DOESN'T do any serialization on call. The serialization occurs only on the world snapshot generation. That's why you don't need to call Set() every time you want to "update" your list in database. It's already set. However, for a non-immutable objects you need to call Set() to commit the changed value for the provided key.

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesServer.IDatabaseService.TryGet``1(System.String,System.String,``0@)

member.summary:
Sets item count. The count must not exceed MaxItemsPerStack of its item type.
Please note: if count is zero, the item will be destroyed. You cannot change countToDestroy of the item after that.
member.param: New count for item. It must not exceed MaxItemsPerStack of its item type (an exception will be thrown).
If true, the update command will be sent to the provided character.

member.name: M:AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.ServicesServer.IItemsServerService.StackItems(AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,AtomicTorch.CBND.GameApi.Data.Items.IItem,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Removes count from the first item and adds it to the second item.
Applicable only for stackable items of the same type.
Please note that if you specify "count==itemFrom.Count" it will destroy "itemFrom" completely!
Please note if you don't specify count (or specify 0), this method will move as much as possible.
member.param: Count to move (if 0 - move as much as possible).
